plugins.name: Frame Manager
plugins.description:
A simple but powerful tool for organizing and fixing frames in Figma. Detect duplicates, fix naming issues, and ensure proper dimensions in your design files.

Full Description

Frame Manager helps you maintain clean and well-organized Figma files by providing essential tools for working with frames.

Key Features:

🔍 Duplicate Frame Detection & Removal

Instantly find frames with identical names

Option to automatically remove duplicates while keeping one instance

Clean up messy files by eliminating redundant elements

🏷️ Frame Name Standardization

Identify frames with non-standard naming conventions

Automatically fix frame names to follow consistent PascalCase format

Enforce naming consistency across your design system

📏 Size Optimization

Find frames with dimensions not divisible by 2

Fix frame sizes to ensure clean rendering on various displays

Find frames with non-power-of-2 dimensions for texture optimization

How It Works

Install the plugin and run it from the Plugins menu

Select the feature you need from the simple, intuitive interface

Get instant feedback as the plugin detects issues or fixes problems

Enjoy a cleaner, more organized Figma file

Perfect For

Design teams working on large files

Designers preparing assets for developers

Anyone who wants to maintain consistent naming and sizing in their designs

Technical Details

Lightweight and fast - analyzes your file without lag

Non-destructive - always gives you control over changes

Works with any Figma file containing frames

Maintain better design hygiene and save hours of manual cleanup with Frame Manager!


2025 - WildCard Studios - Art Department
plugins.tagline: Clean & organize frames: find duplicates, fix names, proper dimensions with one-click solutions.

plugins.name: Frontify Template Checker
plugins.description:
This plugin checks your Figma designs and highlights potential issues before uploading them as templates into Frontify. It’s designed to improve your template creation and management experience — making the integration between Figma and Frontify more seamless.


Issues

We’re continuously refining and expanding the list of checks. This initial release focuses on the most common issues, with more to come. As we improve template import capabilities, some checks may also be retired.


  1. Auto-layout frames
  2. Layers with multiple fills
  3. Frames with image fills
  4. Text case transformations
  5. Image filters
  6. Mixed text styles within a single text element
  7. Unsupported elements
  8. Empty pages
  9. Slice layers
  10. Flip transformations
  11. OpenType features
  12. Hanging punctuation


Support

If you come across issues not currently covered by the plugin, please contact your Customer Success Manager or email us at support@frontify.com.

accepted.name: Frontify
accepted.description: With our best-in-class brand management platform, Frontify is on a mission to create a home where all brands can thrive.

plugins.tagline: A simple tool to help you prepare your template for Frontify, right within Figma.

Support

128166.release_notes:

128166.tagline: A simple tool to help you prepare your template for Frontify, right within Figma.

plugins.name: Sync Variables with Notion
plugins.description:
Synchronizes variables from a Notion database to a Figma document's Variable Collection. This is particularly useful for managing application text in Notion or supporting multiple languages.


🔥 How to use


Sync collection tab

Connects a Notion database to a Figma Variable Collection and synchronizes their values. Settings are saved per Figma document.


1. Database ID

Specify the Notion database ID (Reference).


2. Integration token

First, create a new integration in Notion (Reference). Next, grant your integration page permissions (Reference). Enter the copied token.


3. Key property name

Specify the name of the Notion property that serves as the unique key for the variables (e.g., Name, Key, ID). Currently, title, formula, and text properties are supported as keys.


4. Collection name to create or update

Specify the name of the Figma Variable Collection to sync with. Existing local collection names will be suggested via autocomplete. If the specified collection doesn't exist, it will be created.


5. Add or reorder modes

Specify the Notion property names that correspond to Figma Variable Modes. These properties will hold the variable values for each mode (e.g., language).


  1. Adding modes:
  2. Enter a mode name in the textbox (e.g., ja, en, or other property names in your Notion database).
  3. Click the "Add" button to add it to the list.
  4. Reordering modes: Modes in the list can be reordered via drag and drop. This order will be reflected in the order of Figma variable modes.
  5. Removing modes: Click the X icon to the right of each mode name to remove that mode from the list.


After entering the information for steps 1-4, click the "Sync variable collection with Notion" button to start the synchronization. This process might take some time depending on the number of items in the database and the variables.


List tab

About list tab

Displays variables from the selected Collection. Only STRING type variables applicable to TEXT_CONTENT are shown. You can copy keys and values, and filter the list by key or value. Clicking on a row reveals the button described below.


"Apply variable to selected text" button

Select text layers in Figma and click the button to apply the variable.


Display mode

Select the Variable Mode (e.g., language) to display its corresponding values in the list.


About caching

When the target collection is a library collection, this plugin caches its information in client storage. This is done because fetching library collections with many variables can be time-consuming and might hit Figma's API rate limits. Clicking the "Refresh" button clears the cache and fetches the latest variable data.


Utilities tab

Provides several utility actions to help manage variables and their application to text layers.


Target collection

Select the Variable Collection to target for the actions. You can choose a collection or all collections.


Target text range

Select the scope for the actions: "Selection", "Current page", or "All pages". You can also choose whether to include text layers within components ("Include text within components") or instances ("Include text within instances") using the respective checkboxes.


Limit variable name

Optionally, enter text here to limit the "Bulk apply variables" action to only those variables whose names contain the specified text.


"Bulk apply variables" button

Automatically applies variables to text layers within the selected range. It matches text content with variable values across all modes in the target collection(s).


"Highlight applied variables" button

Visualizes variable usage on text layers. Text layers with variables applied are highlighted in blue, while those without are highlighted in red.


📮 Support

If you have any problems or feedback, please use the GitHub Issues.


===


This plugin was created by Ryo Nakae 🙎‍♂️.


https://brdr.jp

https://x.com/ryo_dg

https://github.com/ryonakae
plugins.tagline: Sync text from Notion database to variable collection of Figma.

https://brdr.jp

https://x.com/ryo_dg

https://github.com/ryonakae
132062.release_notes:
- Refactored code to improve processing speed and stability
- Fixed an issue where caching would fail when selecting library collections with thousands of variables (now displays variable lists without caching)
- Implemented UI-level caching of library collection data while the plugin is running (this reduces API calls even when library collections cannot be cached in Client Storage)
- Various minor bug fixes and improvements
132062.tagline: Sync text from Notion database to variable collection of Figma.

plugins.name: Design Feedback Lite
plugins.description: Instantly review selected frames using core UX principles. Get structured feedback, radar scoring, and real-time insights — all powered by design psychology.
plugins.tagline: Instant UX feedback on your designs — backed by psychology.

126473.name: Design Feedback Lite
126473.description: Instantly review selected frames using core UX principles. Get structured feedback, radar scoring, and real-time insights — all powered by design psychology.
126473.release_notes:
✨ Viewport-aware analysis: Mobile and desktop designs now get context-appropriate feedback.

⚠️ Contrast issues now tiered: Low, medium, and high severity for better prioritization.

💡 Smart Mode improved: Skips system layers like status bars, navs, and menu bars.

🧠 Accessibility standard toggle: Choose between WCAG 2.1 AA and AAA.

🎯 Refined touch and text size rules: Based on device context and layer type.

🎨 Sleek new UI: Modern layout, grouped controls, and better legibility.

Small plugin. Big feedback. Smarter than ever.
126473.tagline: Instant UX feedback on your designs — backed by psychology.

The plugin includes customizable templates, authentic text content (e.g., Yoruba proverbs, Pidgin phrases, or local idioms), cultural icons, and elements inspired by Nigeria’s rich diversity. Whether designing for digital products, branding, or social media, the plugin ensures an authentic touch, fostering deeper connections with Nigerian audiences. Users can tweak settings to suit various languages, regions, and styles, making it a versatile tool for creative professionals.

plugins.name: Text binder for AI
plugins.description:
Text Binder for AI

A LLM-optimized plugin that lets you enhance text content with AI while preserving your Figma designs. Built with AI guardrails, this plugin safely extracts, processes, and updates text across multiple frames without breaking layouts or losing design fidelity.


✨ Key Features

🎯 AI-Ready Content Extraction

  1. Extract text with reference tags for LLM processing
  2. Maintain exact positioning and styling information
  3. Process multiple frames simultaneously
  4. Built-in prompts and guardrails for AI safety


🔄 Validated Content Updates

  1. Preview AI-generated changes before applying
  2. Intelligent length validation for layout preservation
  3. Real-time status checks for each text element
  4. Clear warnings for potential layout impacts


🚀 Getting Started

  1. Select your target frames
  2. Extract text with AI-friendly reference tags
  3. Use any LLM while maintaining the safety tags
  4. Review changes with automatic validation
  5. Apply updates with confidence
plugins.tagline: AI-enhanced, design-protected

plugins.name: Figma Variable to Code
plugins.description:
This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.


For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.


  1. Load the variable collections
  2. Choose the collection you want to generate variables for
  3. Paste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting list
  4. Click generate
  5. Copy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebase


Note: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
plugins.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

122624.name: Figma Variable to Code
122624.description:
This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.


For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.


  1. Load the variable collections
  2. Choose the collection you want to generate variables for
  3. Paste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting list
  4. Click generate
  5. Copy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebase


Note: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
122624.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

plugins.name: Nataicons
plugins.description:
A fun-themed simple open source icon featuring over 200 delightful design. A free and expansive icon library right inside Figma.


🔑 Key Features


  1. 200+ Unique Icons: A diverse collection to suit various design needs.
  2. Drag and Drop: Seamlessly add icons to your designs.
  3. Free for All: Use in personal and commercial projects without restrictions.
  4. Developer-Friendly: Available as React and Vue packages for easy integration.


💡 How It Works


  1. Open plugin and browse our extensive icon collection.
  2. Drag your chosen icon directly into your file.
  3. Customize and resize as needed.


🐞 Got ideas or found a bug?


Comment or contact me in Threads. Your feedback helps make this plugin even better for everyone!

plugins.name: Toggle Visibility By Type
plugins.description:
Toggle Visibility by Type is designed to streamline your design workflow by allowing you to quickly toggle the visibility of selected layers based on their type.

Whether you’re working with 🖼️ images, 📝 text, 🔲 shapes, 🔗 paths, ↔️ lines, 📁 groups, or 📐 frames, this plugin provides an intuitive interface to control which elements are visible in your design. Simply select the layers or groups you want to modify, choose the layer type you want to toggle, and hit the ☑️ button.


This plugin is especially useful for managing complex designs and improving your efficiency in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Quickly toggle visibility of selected layers by type!

99518.name: Toggle Visibility By Type
99518.description:
Toggle Visibility by Type is designed to streamline your design workflow by allowing you to quickly toggle the visibility of selected layers based on their type.

Whether you’re working with 🖼️ images, 📝 text, 🔲 shapes, 🔗 paths, ↔️ lines, 📁 groups, or 📐 frames, this plugin provides an intuitive interface to control which elements are visible in your design. Simply select the layers or groups you want to modify, choose the layer type you want to toggle, and hit the ☑️ button.


This plugin is especially useful for managing complex designs and improving your efficiency in Figma.
99518.tagline: Quickly toggle visibility of selected layers by type!

plugins.name: Easy Select
plugins.description:
Easy Select helps you expedite the tedious and repetitive selection workflows with handy 1-click shortcuts.


-> Simply select one item, then:

  1. Select its parent / children / siblings
  2. Select others with the same color, name, size, rotation ...


-> Or, select a few items, then:

  1. Filter down to those with a particular type, name...


-> Save your carefully curated selections as bookmarks for reuse.


-> Restore from a list of historical selections.


For questions or feedback, please email easy-select@smarter.town.
plugins.tagline: The all-in-one selection helper

plugins.name: Easily Name output
plugins.description:
Step 1: Export Name Mapping


Prefix the node name with "▼". For example: "▼page-template".

Enter the Google Sheet URL in the first input field or click the file button to select a file.

The number of nodes must match the number of rows in the uploaded document (excluding the title).

The name mapping should be in the first column, with the column header named "Name".

Specify the corresponding sheet name.

If an XLSX file is selected, the first sheet will be prefilled.

Step 2: Export


Select the nodes to be exported.

If none are selected, all nodes on the current page starting with "▼" will be exported.

Choose the export format (PDF/PNG/JPG/SVG).
plugins.tagline: Replace Export Names for Figma Frame Types

92594.description:

The name mapping should be in the first column, with the column header named "Name".

Step 2: Export

If none are selected, all nodes on the current page starting with "▼" will be exported.

Choose the export format (PDF/PNG/JPG/SVG).
92594.tagline: Replace Export Names for Figma Frame Types

plugins.name: Zero Me
plugins.description:
Zero Me: Center Your Starting Point


Start designing from anywhere on the canvas, and when you're ready, let Zero Me center your creations. Simply select your frames and objects, run the plugin, and Zero Me will position your designs at coordinates (0, 0), keeping your canvas clean and organized.


Zero Me is a small but mighty Figma plugin that simplifies the process of centering and aligning your designs. It's for designers who want to maintain a tidy workspace and ensure a consistent starting point for their projects.


Key Features:

1. Center Alignment: Zero Me sets the position of your selected frames and objects to coordinates (0, 0), providing a centered starting point for your designs.

2. Multiple Object Support: Select multiple frames and objects, and Zero Me will align them all to the center of the canvas.


Install Zero Me and experience the convenience of a centered starting point for your Figma designs.


Created by Taryn + Claude 3 Opus
plugins.tagline: Center you Frames, Objects, Sections, and Self 🧘

plugins.name: Variables JSON Import
plugins.description:
Batch-import design tokens from JSON.


Thanks to Travis Spomer for the original version. <3


This Figma plugin converts Design Token Community Group (DTCG)-formatted JSON into Figma Variables.


Limitations

•Works in the Figma desktop app and Chrome.

Safari isn’t supported because browser file-access restrictions block the import.

•Not a full DTCG parser—some valid files may fail to load.


Supported token types

•string

•number / dimension / duration

•boolean

•Aliases to any supported token in the same JSON or Figma file

•Aliases to tokens in other JSON / Figma files (if those variables are published to a team library)


Open-source → https://github.com/thierryc/figma-variables-JSON-import

accepted.name: Thierry
accepted.description: I am Thierry – a designer, developer, and, typographer based New York. I’ve worked with companies large and small, building and maintaining design systems.

plugins.tagline: Import variables from a single JSON file, or multiple modes from multiple JSON files.

plugins.name: 클로드야 번역해줘 얍-🪄
plugins.description:
Claude AI의 강력한 자연어 처리 기능을 활용하여 Figma 디자인의 텍스트를 자연스럽게 번역합니다. 단순한 기계 번역이 아닌, 맥락을 이해하고 자연스러운 번역을 제공합니다.


* Anthropic API 키가 필요합니다 *


주요 기능:

  1. 한국어, 영어, 일본어, 중국어 지원
  2. 앱 UI, 웹사이트, 구어체, 공식문서 등 다양한 번역 스타일
  3. 선택한 텍스트만 번역 또는 전체 페이지 번역
  4. 실시간 번역 진행 상황 및 상세 로그 제공
  5. Anthropic의 Claude AI 기술 활용


사용 방법:

  1. 설정에 Anthropic API 키 입력 및 테스트 > 저장
  2. 번역하고 싶은 레이어 선택
  3. 원본 언어와 번역할 언어 선택
  4. 번역 스타일 선택
  5. '번역하기' 버튼 클릭
plugins.tagline: Claude AI로 Figma 디자인의 텍스트를 자연스럽게 번역하세요.

plugins.name: flowwwww
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflows with flowwwww, the ultimate plugin for creating dynamic connectors between frames, components, and other objects in Figma. Whether you're designing user flows, wireframes, or complex diagrams, flowwwwwempowers you to create professional, customizable connections with ease.


Key Features

Intuitive Connector Creation

Select two frames or components, and flowwwww will instantly generate a connector between them.


Highly Customizable

Personalize your connectors with adjustable properties:

Stroke color and size.

Add text annotations to label your connectors for enhanced clarity.


Smart Obstacle Avoidance

Enable Obstacle Mode to automatically detect and avoid overlapping objects, ensuring clean and unobstructed connectors.

Perfect for complex designs where connectors need to navigate around other elements.



Use Cases

User Flows : Map out user journeys with clear, annotated connectors between screens.

Wireframing : Create structured layouts with precise connections between components.

Technical Diagrams : Build flowcharts, process maps, and other technical illustrations with ease.

Prototyping : Enhance your prototypes with interactive and visually appealing connectors.


How It Works

Install the flowwwww plugin from the Figma Community.

Select two frames, components, or rectangles that you want to connect.


Configure your connector settings (color, style, etc.) via the plugin interface.


Let flowwwww do the rest—watch as it creates beautiful, dynamic connectors that adapt to your design.


Why Choose flowwwww?

flowwwww is more than just a connector tool—it’s a productivity booster for designers who value precision, flexibility, and efficiency. With its robust feature set and seamless integration into Figma, flowwwww is the go-to solution for anyone looking to elevate their design workflow.


Feedback and Support

We’re committed to making flowwwww the best it can be! If you have any suggestions, encounter issues, or simply love the plugin, we’d love to hear from you. Leave a comment on the Figma Community page or reach out to us directly.


Get Started Today

Install flowwwww now and experience the power of effortless connector creation. Simplify your design process and bring your ideas to life with clarity and precision.
plugins.tagline: Effortless Connector Creation for Figma

plugins.name: RePic
plugins.description:
Smart Bulk Image Replacement for Figma

Boost your design workflow with bulk image replacement. Effortlessly swap images into your Figma projects with just a few clicks—select your target images, pick replacements, and let RePic handle the rest. Perfect for updating mockups, prototypes, or templates, RePic auto-fills extra slots with a transparent placeholder and offers a "delete after replace" option for a clutter-free canvas.


How to Use RePic

  1. Select images (or their frame) to replace.
  2. Select replacement images next.
  3. Click Replace Images—done!

Optional: Check "Delete after use"
plugins.tagline: Lightning-Fast Bulk Image Replacement

127982.name: RePic
127982.description:
Smart Bulk Image Replacement for Figma

Boost your design workflow with bulk image replacement. Effortlessly swap images into your Figma projects with just a few clicks—select your target images, pick replacements, and let RePic handle the rest. Perfect for updating mockups, prototypes, or templates, RePic auto-fills extra slots with a transparent placeholder and offers a "delete after replace" option for a clutter-free canvas.


How to Use RePic

  1. Select images (or their frame) to replace.
  2. Select replacement images next.
  3. Click Replace Images—done!

Optional: Check "Delete after use"

plugins.name: Side note
plugins.description:
Meet Side Note, your minimalist companion for organizing thoughts, ideas, and to-dos in style. Side Note is designed for simplicity, focus, and seamless integration with your creative workflow. Whether you're jotting down quick ideas or capturing important notes, Side Note keeps everything neat and accessible.


Key Features:


  1. Customizable Notes: Add titles, content, and importance labels to make each note unique.
  2. Smart Sizing: Flexible vertical layouts with precise padding for a polished design.
  3. Intuitive Interface: Clean, modern UI for a distraction-free note-taking experience.
  4. Important Labeling: Highlight key notes with an elegant "Important" tag for quick prioritization.
  5. Effortless Integration: Built for seamless use within Figma, perfect for designers on the go.
plugins.tagline: Quick Notes, Seamless Workflow.

plugins.name: skinnerplugin
plugins.description:
Bring your CSS themes to life effortlessly with Skinner. This plugin empowers designers to create, manage, and apply consistent styles across all elements of their Figma projects with ease. By simply providing a CSS theme, Skinner instantly generates paint styles for backgrounds, text, and accents, enabling a streamlined and cohesive design workflow.


With Skinner, you can:


Generate and update styles in seconds.

Maintain a consistent design aesthetic across your projects.

Easily switch between different color themes and accents for versatile design needs.

Whether you’re designing for web, mobile, or any digital interface, Skinner ensures that your styles are always organized, professional, and ready for use.


Simplify. Style. Create. With Skinner.
plugins.tagline: Skinner - Seamless Style Generation for Figma

plugins.name: Wrighty
plugins.description:
Meet Wrighty – your go-to Figma plugin for instant, AI-powered content generation! Imagine filling all your screens with perfectly crafted text in seconds. Wrighty doesn’t just generate words; it adapts them. From landing pages to app flows, Wrighty intuitively matches your specified tone and context, creating unique, on-brand content for every screen you design.


Forget hours spent drafting and editing copy. With Wrighty, just a few clicks auto-generate clear, compelling text that resonates with your target audience. Need to rephrase content across multiple screens? No problem—Wrighty does it all, maintaining consistency and quality to let you focus on design.


Why Wrighty? It’s fast, smart, and seamless. Wrighty empowers you to scale your creative output, delivering screen-ready content that’s as polished as your visuals. Join thousands of Figma users who have already leveled up their workflow with Wrighty. Generate more, customize better, and design faster with Wrighty—the content engine that keeps up with your creativity!
plugins.tagline: AI-powered assistant for all UX writing needs.

108574.description:

plugins.name: RTS CopyBookCreator
plugins.description:
The plugin pulls all texts from selected frames and creates a CSV-file. The CSV will have 4 columns to help you organize your copybook. These columns are: Name of the Frame, Name of the Group, Name of the Text-Style, Text. If you organize your designs accordingly, you'll get a neatly structured Copybook.


Important: The plugin uses semicolons as delimiter, so that Excel can show the CSV properly.
plugins.tagline: Pulls all texts from your figma designs and creates a csv file.

107835.name: RTS CopyBookCreator
107835.description:

Important: The plugin uses semicolons as delimiter, so that Excel can show the CSV properly.
107835.tagline: Pulls all texts from your figma designs and creates a csv file.

plugins.name: TRANS-AI
plugins.description:
TRANS-AI helps designers create multilingual designs by translating text layers and automatically adjusting layouts for right-to-left languages.


Key Features:

  1. Translate selected text layers using OpenAI, Anthropic, or Gemini API (bring your own API key)
  2. One-click layout conversion between RTL and LTR designs
  3. Option to automatically adjust layouts when translating to/from RTL languages
  4. Exclude specific layers from translation using the layer name filter
  5. Preserves text formatting while converting layouts


Perfect for teams creating multilingual products, localizing interfaces, or working with global audiences. TRANS-AI streamlines the localization workflow, saving designers hours of manual adjustments when adapting designs for different languages.
plugins.tagline: Go global in seconds! AI-powered translation with smart RTL/LTR layout conversion.

133981.name: TRANS-AI
133981.description:
TRANS-AI helps designers create multilingual designs by translating text layers and automatically adjusting layouts for right-to-left languages.


Key Features:

  1. Translate selected text layers using OpenAI, Anthropic, or Gemini API (bring your own API key)
  2. One-click layout conversion between RTL and LTR designs
  3. Option to automatically adjust layouts when translating to/from RTL languages
  4. Exclude specific layers from translation using the layer name filter
  5. Preserves text formatting while converting layouts


Perfect for teams creating multilingual products, localizing interfaces, or working with global audiences. TRANS-AI streamlines the localization workflow, saving designers hours of manual adjustments when adapting designs for different languages.

networkAccess.reasoning: API connections to translation services and cloud proxy

133981.release_notes:
- Added more languages
- Fixed small bugs
133981.tagline: Go global in seconds! AI-powered translation with smart RTL/LTR layout conversion.

plugins.name: Pixel Pal: Mood Dancer
plugins.description: A cute pixel-art designer girl lives in your plugin panel. She starts off sleeping 💤, dances 💃 when you click her, and gets scared 😱 when you long-press. Bonus? Each click shows you a random, inspiring or hilarious quote. She’s your creative companion — and now, she even plays music to vibe along while you design!
plugins.tagline: Meet Pixel Pal: Mood Dancer - your tiny Figma vibe companion.

plugins.name: Vertical Trim Cap Height Scanner
plugins.description:
This plugin makes it easy to find text that has had "Cap Height to baseline" vertical trim applied with the click of a button.

It's a useful tool to find and fix incorrectly applied text trims.


How to use:

  1. Click the button on the page you want to search.
  2. Click on trimmed text to select it and modify manually.
  3. Click the button again to confirm the text no longer appears in results.


Tips for fixes:

  1. Be careful when changing trim settings to "Standard" as it may cause layout shifts.
  2. Start by fixing text with the "Main component" tag first.


日本語訳

ボタンをクリックするだけで、上下トリミングに「ベースラインまでのキャップハイト」が設定されているテキストを見つけることができます。

誤って上下トリミングを設定してしまった時に便利なツールです。


使い方：

  1. 検索したいページでボタンをクリックします。
  2. トリミングが設定されたテキストをクリックし、手動で修正します。
  3. 再度ボタンをクリックし、検索結果に表示されなくなったことを確認します。


修正時のコツ：

  1. トリミングを標準に変更するとレイアウトシフトが発生するので、慎重に修正しましょう。
  2. 「メインコンポーネント」タグのついたテキストから先に修正するのがおすすめです。
plugins.tagline: Search for text with "Cap height to baseline" set for vertical trim

plugins.name: Combine Pages
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin built for designers who value organization just as much as iteration.


Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Select any number of pages, and this plugin will neatly group their content into a single new page titled Archive [date]. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.
plugins.tagline: Merge pages. Archive cleanly.

128785.name: Combine Pages
128785.description:
A Figma plugin built for designers who value organization just as much as iteration.


Whether you're wrapping up a sprint, handing off files, or simply cleaning house, Archive & Combine Pages helps you bring order to your design file with ease. Select any number of pages, and this plugin will neatly group their content into a single new page titled Archive [date]. Each page’s content is preserved as a section, spaced evenly and grouped for clarity. Once processed, original pages are renamed with an ARCHIVED_ prefix — so nothing gets lost, but everything gets tidied.

plugins.name: Layer Name Lister
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that provides a hierarchical view of selected layers and their children. This plugin makes it easy to copy layer names with their complete hierarchy or simple structure for documentation, handoff, or reference purposes.


Also pretty useful if the layers need to be fed to an LLM for cross checking against a checklist of fields that need to be included in the UI (that's why I developed this plugin)


Features

- Recursive Layer Traversal: Lists all selected layers and recursively shows their children

- Multiple Output Formats:

- Full Paths: Shows complete hierarchical paths of each layer

- Simple Names: Shows only the layer names without parent paths

- JSON Format: Structured data format including layer IDs, types, and hierarchy

- Cycle Detection: Avoids infinite loops with automatic cycle detection

- Copy to Clipboard: One-click copy of the entire layer hierarchy

- Live Updates: Automatically updates when selection changes

- Resizable Interface: Adjust the plugin window size to your needs

- Performance Optimized: Handles large layer structures efficiently with batch processing


Outputs

Full Paths (Default)

Frame 1
Frame 1 / Button
Frame 1 / Button / Label
Frame 1 / Button / Icon
Frame 1 / Content
Frame 1 / Content / Title
Frame 1 / Content / Description


Simple Names

Frame 1
Button
Label
Icon
Content
Title
Description


JSON Format

[
{
"id": "1:2",
"name": "Frame 1",
"type": "FRAME",
"path": "Frame 1",
"level": 0,
"children": [
{
"id": "1:3",
"name": "Button",
"type": "INSTANCE",
"path": "Frame 1 / Button",
"level": 1,
"children": [...]
},
...
]
}
]
plugins.tagline: A plugin that will give you a plain text list of the layers you have selected (incl. children)

plugins.name: Interaction saver
plugins.description:
The plugin is easy to use:

  1. Save interactions by click on an interaction node.
  2. Use interactions between two frames from the saved interactions.
plugins.tagline: Quickly save and reuse interactions to speed up your prototyping process

plugins.name: Token Template
plugins.description: When working with variables on an ongoing project, the structure of your variables evolves with each version. This plugin allows you to create "Releases" to capture the current state of your document's variables and export them in individual structures, distinguishing between active and older versions. Token Template also helps you maintain identical variable exports across multiple Figma documents. The plugin is currently in beta.
plugins.tagline: Release-versioning and export of variables

136017.name: Token Template
136017.description: When working with variables on an ongoing project, the structure of your variables evolves with each version. This plugin allows you to create "Releases" to capture the current state of your document's variables and export them in individual structures, distinguishing between active and older versions. Token Template also helps you maintain identical variable exports across multiple Figma documents. The plugin is currently in beta.
136017.release_notes: - Bugfix in exporting without collection names

plugins.name: DAM | Panel
plugins.description:
Access your DAM assets directly from within Figma. Import your creative assets into your Figma designs.

Keep your design up to date by verifying assets from your DAM.


See how you can easily place Assets in Figma (Video)


Requires a Connection Key to connect with your DAM instance. Please contact your account manager for more details.


Reach out to our team with any issues or suggestions: support@eixglobal.com
plugins.tagline: Access your DAM assets from Figma
